alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 09 at 9:40PM MST until October 11 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan, Gila River at Calva, Gila River near Solomon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage: Water could begin to damage the dike structure that protects Duncan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MST Sunday the stage was 14.15 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 945 AM MST.
